title: Jean Carioca (footballer, born 1978)
text:
Jean da Silva Duarte, commonly known as Jean Carioca (born 1 September 1978) is a retired <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>ian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> defender.
Career.
Born in <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a>, thus also often known as Jean Carioca (in Portuguese Carioca means natural in Rio), he played for his home town clubs <a href="Botafogo%20de%20Futebol%20e%20Regatas">Botafogo de Futebol e Regatas</a> and <a href="Madureira%20Esporte%20Clube">Madureira Esporte Clube</a> before moving to <a href="Moto%20Club%20de%20S%C3%A3o%20Lu%C3%ADs">Moto Club de São Luís</a>, a club where he will often return during his career. He played with <a href="Sampaio%20Corr%C3%AAa%20Futebol%20Clube">Sampaio Corrêa Futebol Clube</a> before moving abroad in February 2003 to join Serbian club <a href="OFK%20Beograd">OFK Beograd</a> playing back then in the <a href="First%20League%20of%20Serbia%20and%20Montenegro">First League of Serbia and Montenegro</a>. After returning to Brazil he represented Moto Club and <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Atl%C3%A9tica%20Luzi%C3%A2nia">Associação Atlética Luziânia</a> before signing a one year contract in December 2005 with <a href="Ceil%C3%A2ndia%20Esporte%20Clube">Ceilândia Esporte Clube</a>, Moto Club and Sampaio Correia, before joining <a href="Gr%C3%AAmio%20Barueri%20Futebol">Grêmio Barueri Futebol</a> in 2008. Afterwards he played again with Ceilandia, Moto Club before joining <a href="Rio%20Branco%20Football%20Club">Rio Branco Football Club</a> in May 2009.
